job title: Scientist, Cellular Physiology and Perturbations Group
job description:
Who we are:

Calico is a research and development company whose mission is to harness advanced technologies to increase our understanding of the biology that controls lifespan, and to devise interventions that enable people to lead longer and healthier lives. Executing on this mission will require an unprecedented level of interdisciplinary effort and a long-term focus for which funding is already in place.

Position description:

Calico is seeking a Scientist to be a founding member of a new team focused on functional genomics and cellular physiology. This team will combine genome engineering, fluorescent reporters, genome-scale CRISPR libraries and high-content phenotyping of a diverse range of mammalian cell cultures (from cancer lines to primary cells to iPSCs and derivatives thereof).

In this role, you will collaborate with life scientists, data scientists, machine learning engineers and hardware engineers to tackle a variety of biological problems. Your primary responsibility will be to develop assays, engineer cell lines and implement functional genomics screens. You will work with a range of cutting edge technologies, including CRISPR libraries, robotics and microscopy. To succeed in this role, you will need to be self-motivated, collaborative and enthusiastic about technology.

Position requirements:
  • Ph.D. degree in cell biology, molecular biology, genetics or related field
  • A completed postdoc or four years of relevant experience in genome engineering, assays development or CRISPR screening
  • Track record of productivity and effective collaboration
  • Ability to be flexible in a fast-pace environment with shifting priorities
  • Clear verbal and written communication skills
  • Attention to detail, time management and organization skills are a must
Additional desired experience:
  • iPSCs and organoid culture
  • Quantitative microscopy and high-content screening
  • Basic programming/scripting
  • Automation
  • Project management
